title: Patient-Reported Outcomes in Older Adults With Transthyretin Amyloid Cardiomyopathy - JACC

summary.text: Patient-reported outcomes in older adults with transthyretin amyloid cardiomyopathy (TTCM) highlight the need for tailored management strategies that prioritize functional status and symptom burden.

The study underscores the importance of incorporating patient perspectives into clinical decision-making, particularly regarding treatment options such as TTE-CMR and initiation of TTR-modulating therapies in the elderly population.

Operational insights suggest that enhancing patient-reported outcome measures could improve data collection processes, ultimately leading to better-informed patient care plans and more effective communication between healthcare providers and older adult patients with TTCM.
